benchmark_details.name: CBVS (Chinese Video Search Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: CBVS is a large-scale benchmark designed for Chinese short video search scenarios, providing a manual fine-labeling dataset and two large-scale datasets to support cover-based video retrieval tasks.
benchmark_details.data_type: video cover-image pairs and user query-video cover pairs

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a benchmark for evaluating vision-language models in the context of Chinese short video search.

data.source: User query logs from the QQ Browser and videos from Chinese video platforms such as BiliBili and Tencent Video.
data.size: 20,001 image-text pairs for CBVS-20K; 5M and 10M video cover-title pairs for CBVS-5M/10M.
data.annotation: Manually annotated by trained human experts with cross-validation.

methodology.calculation: Based on similarity scores of matched image and text embeddings using ITC loss.
methodology.interpretation: Higher recall and MAP indicate better performance of the model in retrieving relevant video images for user queries.
methodology.baseline_results: UniCLIP achieves state-of-the-art performance compared to other models evaluated on CBVS-20K.
methodology.validation: Cross-validation for relevance scoring of user queries.
